newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 11.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on April 11. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

The government has to account for most nontax revenue in the annual state budget and local administrations have to abolish several taxes and levies under new laws passed by the House of Representatives. The House on Thursday unanimously approved bills on local taxes and levies, fees on land and building rights, on tax collection with distress warrants, on tax courts and nontax state revenues.
The Indonesian towns of Wonosobo and Banjarnegara in Central Java have returned to normal after riots on Wednesday.
The Ministry of Tourism, Post and Telecommunication is set to build a cordless telephone network in remote Irian Jaya province in the 1997-98 fiscal year.
